item.title: Ngrx Guards and Resolvers
item.description: In this post, we will have a look at an example of an ngrx application using guards and resolvers. Based on this, we will see when guards and resolvers are best using with ngrx. Personally, I find one of the main advantages of using ngrx is to handle data in a more efficient way, e.g. not re-loading the data when it’s already in state. All the example I found online while learning about ngrx were using guards, and I didn’t quite understand why that was.
